article.class: post-7575 page type-page status-publish has-post-thumbnail hentry

div.p: There are many questions and concerns about graduation and other requirements for the 2020 senior class. We’re working hard to address all questions and support our seniors.
Visit our FAQs page to read the latest updates and submit your questions.

We are also working closely with our partners: The Office of Public Instruction (OSPI), State Board of Education, colleges, community colleges and universities that provide credit-bearing classes for our students.
Be assured that students will not be negatively impacted as a result of events beyond their control. That is our commitment.

Options for conducting graduation ceremonies are being evaluated now and ultimately may be determined by social distancing regulations in the coming weeks and months. Options include virtual graduation ceremonies or possibly postponing ceremonies until late summer.
Please review the graduation credit requirements for the class of 2020.

p.span: Students will be awarded letter grades in the C to A range, or receive an incomplete. Students have the opportunity to raise their grades from whatever their grade was on March 13, 2020, our last physical attendance date. That grade will be the baseline grade for the student moving forward. No grades will be lowered below that baseline grade if students engage with remote learning opportunities offered by their teachers. Teachers will assign grades or assign an “incomplete” for students that cannot engage in an equitable way. We will continue to provide multiple ways for students to engage. In the event an incomplete is assigned, there will be opportunities for students to convert that incomplete to a grade after the school year concludes.

div.p: One of the graduation requirements for the class of 2020 includes a state assessment and/or pathway option. Seniors who have not yet met their state assessment and/or pathway option requirement should contact their school counselor to explore their options. Find contact information for counselors on each school’s website.

Seniors will need to complete their High School & Beyond Plan, per graduation requirements. We are working on a plan to support students completing their plans while schools are closed. Bookmark this webpage and visit often for updates.
We will communicate more information as it becomes available.
Please reach directly to your school counselor or your college directly.
Your teachers will be working with the colleges to determine what is possible given the current situation. Please reach out to your College in the High School teacher if you have specific questions.
Staff is working to ensure standards are met during instructional time after school re-opens. Please reach out to your CTE teachers for the most current information.
div.h5: FALL ADMISSIONS AT WASHINGTON COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES
div.p: Read about the shared commitments our Washington secondary institutions have made to the class of 2020 and beyond. (https://bit.ly/2x9mvgs)
Please use this form to submit senior-related questions.

div.div:
841 NE 22nd Avenue
Camas, WA 98607
phone: 360.335.3000
fax: 360.335.3001
